channel.title: When Gordon Met Chell
channel.description:
[url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Zcdd5wUwubE']https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Zcdd5wUwubE[/url]
Well, uhm... It was a good fan-movie but well some things were pretty awkward... e.g. Gordon's beard.
Your opinions?

Alyx, and her 185 friends.

item.title: When Gordon Met Chell
item.dc:creator: Unforeseen_Physics
item.description:
Next to InfectiousDesigner’s Half Life Origins, this is my favorite HL fan film.
Also, Gordon’s ever so fake beard and hair style and 50-year-old-look didn’t bother me one bit; it made him look like that kind of groovy physician who just doesn’t give a shit.

I love this part:

Read full topic

item.title: When Gordon Met Chell
item.dc:creator: Ghunter43
item.description:
danielsangeo:

Nah, in Portal 1, she says (in reference to your attributions):

On the Emancipation Grill:
“Please be advised that a noticeable taste of blood is not part of any test protocol, but is an unintended side-effect of the Aperture Science Material Emancipation Grill, which may – in semi-rare cases – emancipate dental fillings, crowns, tooth enamel and teeth.”

On the Portal Gun:
“Very good. You are now in possession of the Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device. With it, you can create your own portals. These interdimensional gates have been proven to be completely safe. The device, however, has not. Do not touch the operational end of the device. Do not look directly into the operational end of the device. Do not submerge the device in liquid, even partially. Most importantly: Under no circumstances should you[static]”

On the pools of acid:
“Please note that we have added a consequence for failure. Any contact with the chamber floor will result in an unsatisfactory remark on your official testing record, followed by death. Good luck!”

Well, I was close.

Read full topic

item.title: When Gordon Met Chell
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Ghunter43:

Never heard of GLaDOS saying: Don’t touch the end of the device or directly look into it? It could result in loss of teeth and death? Portal 1?

Nah, in Portal 1, she says (in reference to your attributions):

On the Emancipation Grill:
“Please be advised that a noticeable taste of blood is not part of any test protocol, but is an unintended side-effect of the Aperture Science Material Emancipation Grill, which may – in semi-rare cases – emancipate dental fillings, crowns, tooth enamel and teeth.”

On the Portal Gun:
“Very good. You are now in possession of the Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device. With it, you can create your own portals. These interdimensional gates have been proven to be completely safe. The device, however, has not. Do not touch the operational end of the device. Do not look directly into the operational end of the device. Do not submerge the device in liquid, even partially. Most importantly: Under no circumstances should you[static]”

On the pools of acid:
“Please note that we have added a consequence for failure. Any contact with the chamber floor will result in an unsatisfactory remark on your official testing record, followed by death. Good luck!”

Read full topic

item.title: When Gordon Met Chell
item.dc:creator: Ghunter43
item.description:
Jack Freeman:

I have a question; since when could the Portal Gun dissolve others? :what:

Never heard of GLaDOS saying: Don’t touch the end of the device or directly look into it? It could result in loss of teeth and death? Portal 1?

Maybe I’m not using the correct terms, but I do remember GLaDOS saying that.

Read full topic

item.title: When Gordon Met Chell
item.dc:creator: brokenfridgehinge
item.description:
Not bad, some pretty good moments and decent VFX. I thought that city skyline at the start looked familiar, turns out it’s Melbourne. Finally a decent Australian made fan film, haha.
The same guy also made a pretty decent Max Payne parody too: https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=endscreen&NR=1&v=eU0dgjon10U

Read full topic

item.title: When Gordon Met Chell
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
I wrote that off as one of the many ambiguos things about the gun. “Do not look at the operation end of the device,” for instance. What’ll happen? Can’t be that bright.

I think the costumes were intentionally laughable. I cracked up every time you see a close-up of Gordon’s face. But the visual effects were pretty amazing. I don’t watch many things with lots of fancy video editing effects so my idea may be skewed, but that was some of the coolest editing I’ve seen outside of big budget films.

danielsangeo:

The actress that played Chell was very cute. ;D

I usually keep to myself, but I’ll second this

Read full topic

item.title: When Gordon Met Chell
item.dc:creator: Fnork
item.description:
some things were pretty awkward…
e.g. Gordon’s beard.

Yeah, the costuming and such was pretty laughable, but fortunately, so was the humour.

I liked that it actually went for comedy, as opposed to pretty much all the other fan-films out there that take themselves way too seriously. Resulted in a good bit of fun and far more enjoyability.
I especially liked the mute gags and the overwatch-ball, great stuff.

Read full topic
